title: Community offering support, prayers for deputy's daughter injured in shooting
content:
CENTERVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
A community is coming together after a deputy's daughter was hurt in an accidental shooting.
Alyssa Aydelott, 13, had just finished seventh grade at Hickman County Middle School. Summer break began Thursday, but more than 30 students came back to school on Monday to find comfort.
"There was a presence that we missed. We all wanted her there," said Mike Kelley, a school counselor for Centerville Intermediate.
Grief counselors visited Hickman County Middle on Monday.
Administrators described Alyssa as a beauty queen, a fierce soccer player and a manager of the football team.
"Beautiful, strong, intelligent, a lot of those words," Kelley said.
The Hickman County Sheriff said the teen was accidentally shot at her home on Friday. She was transported to Vanderbilt University Medical Center that same afternoon.
Investigators have released few details about the incident, the firearm, and the people present at the time of the shooting.
District Attorney Kim Helper said her office is assisting the sheriff's department with this case.
The sheriff's department on behalf of the family has posted updates on its Facebook page, where many have also shared their prayers.
The latest post described a difficult night followed by an "upswing" mid-morning.
One woman wrote, "This is why I love my community. We stick together."
According to the Hickman County Sheriff's Office, donations can be dropped off at their office in Centerville.
A GoFundMe page has also been set up in Alyssa's name. Click here for more details.
